metadata.title: CVE-2020-36158 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
mwifiex_cmd_802_11_ad_hoc_start indrivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/join.c in the Linux kernel through5.10.4 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a longSSID value, aka CID-5c455c5ab332.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-204-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-204-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-204-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1089-kvm - 4.4.0-1089.98
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.137
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1095-aws - 4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1109-azure - 4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1094-gcp - 4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-oracle - 4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1147-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1147.157
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1151-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1151.161
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-204.236').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1089.98').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.137').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1151.161').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
